basics.name: Michael Roberts
basics.label: Cybersecurity Student
basics.summary: Forward thinker bringing seven years of experience in information technology, handling and distributing classified material, and resolving complex technical issues. Proven ability to take initiative, support team objectives, and contribute to mission success. Excited to apply my skills and grow with a solution-oriented team. Open to relocation and completing the remainder of my degree program online for out-of-state opportunities.

highlights: Conducted vulnerability assessments using Nessus, configuring and scanning Metasploitable 2 to detect CVE-listed vulnerabilities and weaknesses. Researched and documented mitigation strategies such as system patching, disabling unused ports, and implementing firewall rules.
Completed NIST DoD RMF course, increased understanding of Risk Management Framework Security Controls and their application to IA.

Developed a Python script to scan system files for specific keywords and patterns using the os and regex libraries, incorporating loops, conditionals, and user-defined functions to generate a detailed report of the findings.
Setup Google Authenticator on Ubuntu server, enabling time-based authentication tokens and configuring SSH and PAM settings to require MFA.

Configured Splunk solution on Ubuntu to monitor security events, integrated system logs into data inputs, created search queries to track SSH failed login attempts, built a dashboard with a time chart panel, and simulated failed login attempts to validate the dashboardâ€™s functionality.

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
